title: What's Next For Gavin McKenna? Here's What Happened On "Called Up" Ep. 56
description: This week on Called Up: The Prospects Podcast, hosts Chris Peters and Cam Robinson talked about the chaotic news storm that has hit the professional hockey world this week.  Topics included the predicted overall top pick in the 2026 NHL Draft, Gavin McKenna, being arrested, and the latest news heading into the NHL trade deadline brought about by the 2026 Olympic Winter Games.  Artemi Panarin is goes coast-to-coast to join the Los Angeles Kings while Liam Greentree heads to the Big Apple.
fullText:
This week on Called Up: The Prospects Podcast, hosts Chris Peters and Cam Robinson talked about the chaotic news storm that has hit the professional hockey world this week.

Topics included the predicted overall top pick in the 2026 NHL Draft, Gavin McKenna, being arrested, and the latest news heading into the NHL trade deadline brought about by the 2026 Olympic Winter Games.

Artemi Panarin is goes coast-to-coast to join the Los Angeles Kings while Liam Greentree heads to the Big Apple. Chris and Cam covered the moves and the path forward for the New York Rangers and LA Kings.

Then, they moved onto the best-on-best tournament coming out of Europe and ask "What does Canada need to do to win the Olympic gold?"

Watch Professional, Junior Hockey Games Streaming Live On FloHockey

Who Is Liam Greentree? Rangers Acquire Top Prospect In Artemi Panarin Trade

Read The Latest 2026 Winter Olympics News On FloHockey

You can catch Called Up for free, available on FloHockey and YouTube, every Friday to stay up to date on the latest professional and junior hockey news.

Chris and Cam discuss the latest turn in Gavin McKenna's draft season as the Penn State freshman is facing criminal charges. The duo discuss how this does or doesn't impact McKenna's draft stock, while also examining the implications and discuss prior incidents and how this may be similar or different.

Additionally, Called Up dives into the New York Rangers trade with the Los Angeles Kings for Artemi Panarin and prospect Liam Greentree, who went to NYR.

Lastly, Chris and Cam make time for Olympics talk., discussing what Team Canada and Team USA need to do to win gold, as well as a few other darkhorse teams that could play spoiler against the North American titans.

title: ‚ö†Ô∏èAlarm bells in Madrid: Rodrygo‚Äôs diagnosis confirmed
description: Real Madrid has added a new name to its medical report during a crucial part of the season. After undergoing various medical examinations this Friday, it has been confirmed that Brazilian forward Rodr...
fullText:
Real Madrid has added a new name to its medical report during a crucial part of the season. After undergoing various medical examinations this Friday, it has been confirmed that Brazilian forward Rodrygo Goes is suffering from a physical complication that will keep him off the field, representing a significant setback for √Ålvaro Arbeloa's tactical plans.

According to the official statement issued by the club's Medical Services, the player has been diagnosed with tendinosis in the hamstring of his right leg. Unlike a conventional muscle tear, this condition involves chronic inflammation of the tendon that requires careful management to prevent it from becoming a long-term injury. For now, the club has informed that the player is "pending evolution," without setting a fixed timeline for his return.

The absence of the Brazilian international forces the coaching staff to readjust the offense. Rodrygo will immediately begin a specific recovery plan that includes physiotherapy and low-intensity work. It is expected that the player will miss at least the upcoming league fixtures, while the medical team evaluates his response to the treatment to determine if he will be able to participate in the upcoming international challenges.

title: Ex-Eagles coach quits his job. He could re-join Philly soon?
description: Former Eagles coach quits his job. Could he join Philly?
fullText:
Browns defensive coordinator Jim Schwartz handed Cleveland a resignation letter on Friday and plans to sit out next year, according to ESPN.

Schwartz, who was the Eagles‚Äô defensive coordinator from 2016 to 2020, was upset he didn‚Äôt land the Browns‚Äô heading coaching job. Now he‚Äôs out.

After the 2026 season, Schwartz is projected to be one of the top DC candidates available, and the Eagles could be a perfect fit.

Eagles defensive coordinator Vic Fangio considered retirement after the 2025 season, but the team‚Äôs brass has convinced him to stay for another season, according to multiple reports.

Fangio could coach his final season in 2026, so the Eagles need to come up with a list of potential replacements.

At the top will be Schwartz, who served as the Eagles‚Äô DC when the team won its first Super Bowl during the 2017‚Äì18 season.

Before convincing Fangio to return, the Eagles reached out Schwartz about their DC job, according to PhillyVoice Eagles reporter Jimmy Kempski.

Over the last three years, Schwartz has enjoyed great success as the Browns‚Äô DC, helping Cleveland finish with top-five defenses in two of those seasons.

Under Schwartz, Philadelphia would have a new defensive scheme in 2027, which is not ideal. However, the Eagles would be better off making that change instead of settling for a Fangio assistant who is less qualified.

Of course, it‚Äôs still possible that Fangio coaches beyond 2026. But with the likelihood of him retiring soon, Schwartz is a name to keep an eye on.

title: Thomas M√ºller leaves career end open
description: Former German World Cup winner Thomas M√ºller is yet to decide when he will end his glittering playing career. M√ºller has a contract at Major League Soccer side Vancouver Whitecaps until the end of the year by when he will be 37.
fullText:
Former German World Cup winner Thomas M√ºller is yet to decide when he will end his glittering playing career.

M√ºller has a contract at Major League Soccer side Vancouver Whitecaps until the end of the year by when he will be 37. He joined the Canadian side last summer after 25 trophy-laden years at Bayern Munich.

"As always in my life, I don't commit myself unnecessarily. My
 main motivation for playing football is to enjoy it. The first few months here have been a lot of fun. Now my first full season is coming up," M√ºller told Germany's Welt paper.

M√ºller named his fitness and health a key criteria, saying: "How will my body cope with the whole journey? I struggled a bit towards the end of last season. That's another reason why I haven't fully made up my mind yet."

M√ºller, who was speaking from a training camp in the southern Spanish city of Marbella where the Whitecaps are preparing for the new season, said he still enjoys the role of a player.

"Having the opportunity to decide a home game in the 90th minute with a penalty, feeling that pressure and having the chance to move so many people's emotions with one action when you score ‚Äì that's still worth going to bed earlier for," he said.

"Then I'll just skip the cocktail and have still water instead."

Bayern hope that M√ºller will return to the club in a new capacity once he has ended his playing career but he said that nothing is decided yet.

"The connection to FC Bayern is still there, both emotionally and in terms of content," he said.

"And we have discussed with the club management that there is a possibility of going down a joint path in the future. There is no letter of intent or even a term sheet yet. I don't want to do my coaching licence now (while still playing) or start a degree."

M√ºller said "I want to consciously pursue my education" after the playing career, "instead of frantically trying to get a certificate on the side.

"When I do something, I give it one hundred per cent. I don't want to expect myself or anyone else to get anything less than my full passion, energy and attention."

title: Stefon Diggs Nearly Joined This AFC Playoffs Foe Over Patriots Last Offseason
description: Stefon Diggs played an instrumental role in the New England Patriots making it to Super Bowl LX. The four-time Pro Bowler not only led New England in targets (102), receptions (85) and receiving yards (1,013) during the regular season but gave the offense a veteran presence in the locker room. Diggs revealed this week that [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Stefon Diggs played an instrumental role in the New England Patriots making it to Super Bowl LX.

The four-time Pro Bowler not only led New England in targets (102), receptions (85) and receiving yards (1,013) during the regular season but gave the offense a veteran presence in the locker room.

Diggs revealed this week that he nearly joined the Patriots‚Äô AFC Championship Game opponent ‚Äî the Denver Broncos ‚Äî over the offseason due in part to their head coach, Sean Payton.

‚ÄúI played against Sean Payton a lot. I‚Äôve seen what his offense can do. So, that was the one thing,‚Äù the pass-catcher said, according to the Boston Herald‚Äôs Andrew Callahan. ‚ÄúAnd then a couple of people on the staff that I knew. (Quarterbacks coach) Davis Webb, I was familiar with. He helped me out a lot in Buffalo as far as learning the plays. ‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs kind of how it ended up happening.‚Äù

Diggs added that in the end, New England‚Äôs decision to hire head coach Mike Vrabel last January, plus the presence of quarterback Drake Maye, influenced his final decision.

‚ÄúAnd in weighing my options on what‚Äôs going to be the best, I also like coach (Vrabel.) I had a little bit of interaction with him at the Pro Bowl and stuff like that,‚Äù the 32-year-old said, per Callahan. ‚ÄúAnd they had a young quarterback. They both had young quarterbacks. When you weigh all the pros and cons, I felt the Patriots were probably going to be the best fit.‚Äù

Ex-Patriots QB Joe Milton Dishes On Rumored Feud With Drake Maye

title: Corey Heim will run 12 NASCAR Cup races with 23XI Racing in 2026
description: Thee reigning NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series champion has a Cup ride, for at least a third of the 2026 schedule
fullText:
Many were left shocked by the fact that Corey Heim was without a full-time ride entering the 2026 season. The defending NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series champion broke various records in his 2025 title run, and is considered the sport's top prospect alongside Connor Zilisch.

However, that doesn't mean Heim won't be racing this year. In a Friday announcement, we learned that Heim will be piloting an open entry for 23XI Racing, and is set to compete in a third of the 2026 NASCAR Cup Series schedule -- 12 races.

As the No. 67¬†Toyota Camry XSE doesn't have a charter, he will have to qualify his way into any races exceeding the maximum 40 entries (including the Daytona 500).

Heim's schedule will include all four of NASCAR's crown jewel events. In addition to the 68th running of the Daytona 500, he will also attempt to take part in the Coca-Cola 600 in May, the Brickyard 400 in July, and the Southern 500 in September.

Bootie Barker will partner with Heim as his crew chief for these planned races. He has worked hundreds of races from atop the pit box, and was the crew chief when 23XI won its first Cup race in 2021 with Bubba Wallace.

23XI currently fields three full-time entries with Wallace (No. 23), Riley Herbst (No. 35), and Tyler Reddick (No. 45). Heim will be a fourth entry for the team that appears throughout the year.

Heim has seven previous Cup starts between 2024-2025, five of which came with 23XI. His best showing came in the Bristol Night Race last year, finishing an impressive sixth. He also attempted the Chicago Street Course in 2025, but failed to make the race, showcasing the peril an open entry can sometimes face. However, beyond the 500, Heim shouldn't find it difficult to qualify for most of these planned races in 2026.

May 24 -- Coca-Cola 600 (Charlotte)

May 31 -- Nashville Superspeedway

June 21 -- San Diego Street Course

July 26 -- Brickyard 400 (Indianapolis)

August 29 -- Daytona International Speedway

September 6 -- Southern 500 (Darlington)

October 11 -- Charlotte Motor Speedway

November 8 -- Homestead-Miami Speedway finale

‚ÄúWe know the future is really bright for Corey, and we‚Äôre working with him to ensure that he is as prepared as possible when his time comes to race full time,‚Äù said Denny Hamlin, co-owner of 23XI Racing. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre continuing to stick to our plan and taking a long-term approach, while also remaining focused on what is collectively best for our organization and our partners as we look to continue being a competitive, winning organization each weekend.‚Äù

Added¬†Dave Rogers, 23XI Senior Director, Competition: ‚ÄúCorey‚Äôs development with the team has been impressive and we appreciate his patience and trust in us to prepare him as best as possible. He has not only been a great student but has also provided valuable feedback to our team that has helped us grow. We‚Äôre looking forward to more races with him this year as he continues to sharpen his skills.‚Äù

Even when he's not racing, Heim "will continue to be a regular participant in all aspects of the competition team as they prepare for and analyze races," noted the team's press release. He will also run a yet-to-be-announced number or Truck races with TRICON in 2026.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm excited and honored to continue my progression with 23XI,‚Äù said Heim. ‚ÄúEvery driver wants to race as much as possible, but I‚Äôm fully committed to the approach that I am taking with the team. I look forward to more Cup races this year and the opportunity to grow and expand my race-craft on and off the track.‚Äù

Ranking NASCAR's rising stars to watch in 2026

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: UFC fighter branded a ‚Äòmoron‚Äô by Dana White unsure about competing again
description: Retirement plans have already been made by one of the UFC roster‚Äôs most unique personalities. Dana White‚Äôs admission that he hoped one particular fighter would lose a 2025 bout got fans buzzing with speculation about who he meant.
fullText:
Retirement plans have already been made by one of the UFC roster‚Äôs most unique personalities.

Dana White‚Äôs admission that he hoped one particular fighter would lose a 2025 bout got fans buzzing with speculation about who he meant.

White has not always had smooth relationships with every fighter on the roster. That much has been clear over the years.

Some wondered if it might be related to Alex Pereira‚Äôs rematch with Magomed Ankalaev, given how much the promotion could benefit from a specific result.

Another name thrown into the mix by fans has raised doubts about whether he will even fight again under the UFC banner.

Bryce Mitchell made his bantamweight debut last July, defeating Said Nurmagomedov to get back in the win column.

Previously a ranked featherweight, he built that status off a five-fight winning streak, which included a victory over Edson Barboza in 2022.

While his only losses have come against top-tier opponents like Ilia Topuria, Josh Emmett, and Jean Silva, Mitchell‚Äôs career has had its share of ups and downs.

The defeat to Silva at UFC 314 was already a tough pill to swallow, but it hurt even more given how many fans were against him due to some of his previous controversial remarks.

Speaking on Tim Welch‚Äôs Red Hawk Recap podcast, Mitchell answered whether there was a specific fighter he had in mind for his next appearance.

‚ÄúNot in particular. At this point, I‚Äôm just happy to get what I get, you know? I‚Äôll take anything and I just want another fight. Who knows, they might not give me another fight. I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs gonna happen. If they don‚Äôt give me a fight, I‚Äôll just do blue collar work the rest of my life,‚Äù he stated.

There were plenty of people surprised by the strength of White‚Äôs response to the remarks Mitchell made on the first episode of his ArkanSanity Podcast.

The fighter‚Äôs rant drew heavy criticism, with the UFC president calling it ‚Äúbeyond disgusting‚Äù during a press conference held in January 2025.

White did not hold back, labelling Mitchell a ‚Äúmoron‚Äù, but he stopped short of handing out any formal punishment.

The 56-year-old businessman said: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs free speech. That‚Äôs the beautiful thing about this business, for all of you who hate Bryce Mitchell, you get to see him hopefully get his ass whooped on global television.‚Äù

Georges St-Pierre suggests one UFC champion is on course to surpass him as the GOAT

Dana White feared UFC star could ‚Äòdie‚Äô after absorbing 445 strikes in historic fight

title: Celtic sign London City Lionesses defender Wilde on loan
description: Celtic have completed the signing of defender Maddi Wilde on a loan deal from London City Lionesses until the end of the season.The Ghirls announced the news via a post on their official club website ...
fullText:
The Ghirls announced the news via a post on their official club website this evening.

The 22-year-old defender initially joined London City Lionesses on loan from former club Bristol City during the 2023/2024 season and she signed for the club on a permanent basis at the end of that campaign. Wilde has played a role in the growth of London City Lionesses and she was a Barclays WSL2 title-winner with the club last season.

Wilde has found minutes in short supply this season and she will now continue her development at Celtic.

After securing a loan move north of the border, Wilde said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm really excited to be here at such a massive club. Celtic has so much history about it, and that makes me really excited to get started.

‚ÄúGrant [Scott] spoke to me about the club, and the ambition, so it was a no-brainer to make the move here.‚Äù

Wilde is Celtic‚Äôs second signing from the Barclays Women‚Äôs Super League this week. The Ghirls have also signed Manchester United defender Evie Rabjohn on a permanent deal.

title: Corey Heim driving in 12 NASCAR Cup races with 23XI Racing, including Daytona 500 and Nashville
description: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series champion Corey Heim will drive in 12 Cup Series races with 23XI Racing in 2026, including the Daytona 500.
fullText:
NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series champion Corey Heim will drive in 12 Cup Series races with 23XI Racing in 2026, including the Daytona 500 and the May 31 race at Nashville Superspeedway.

23XI announced Heim's part-time Cup schedule on Feb. 6.

The 23-year-old is currently not scheduled to run a full schedule in any of the three national series in 2026 despite one of the most dominant seasons in Truck Series history last year.

Heim won 12 of 25 Truck Series races in 2025, claiming the Truck title with a victory in the championship race at Phoenix on Oct. 31, 2025.

One of NASCAR's top young prospect drivers, Heim also ran four Cup Series races and three O'Reilly Auto Parts Series races last season.

Heim is currently under contract with 23XI Racing as the team's development driver in a deal announced before last season.

Feb. 15: Daytona 500, Daytona International Speedway (1:30 p.m., FOX)

April 19: AdventHealth 400, Kansas Speedway (1 p.m., FOX)

May 3: Wurth 400, Texas Motor Speedway (2:30 p.m., FS1)

May 24: Coca-Cola 600, Charlotte Motor Speedway (5 p.m., Amazon Prime Video)

May 31: Cracker Barrel 400, Nashville Superspeedway (6 p.m., Amazon Prime Video)

June 21: Anduril 250, Naval Base Coronado in San Diego (3 p.m., Amazon Prime Video)

July 5: NASCAR Cup Series race at Chicagoland Speedway (5 p.m., TNT)

July 26: Brickyard 400, Indianapolis Motor Speedway (1 p.m., TNT)

Aug. 29: Coke Zero Sugar 400, Daytona International Speedway (6:30 p.m., NBC)

Sept. 6: Southern 500, Darlington Raceway (4 p.m., USA Network)

Oct. 11: Bank of America 400, Charlotte Motor Speedway (2 p.m., USA Network)

Nov. 8: NASCAR Cup Series Championship race, Homestead-Miami Speedway (2 p.m., NBC)

This article originally appeared on Nashville Tennessean: Corey Heim's NASCAR schedule in 2026, including 12 Cup Series races

title: How to watch Man Utd v Spurs, team news, predicted line-ups and more
description: Manchester United will look to secure their fourth straight league victory as they host Tottenham Hotspur on Saturday.Michael Carrick could not have hoped for a better start as United manager, and a v...
fullText:
Manchester United will look to secure their fourth straight league victory as they host Tottenham Hotspur on Saturday.

Michael Carrick could not have hoped for a better start as United manager, and a victory against Spurs would put them in a commanding position to secure Champions League qualification.

Here‚Äôs everything you need to know ahead of the clash:

12:30pm UK time, Saturday 7th February

TNT Sports 1/ TNT Sport Ultimate

Streaming available on discovery+

Manchester United: Patrick Dorgu (out), Mason Mount (out), Mathijs De Ligt (out)

Tottenham Hotspur: James Maddison (out), Rodrigo Bentancur (out), Mohammed Kudus (out), Ben Davies (out), Lucas Bergvall (out), Richarlison (out), Pedro Porro (out), Kevin Danso (out), Dejan Kulusevski (out), Dominic Solanke (doubt), Djed Spence (doubt)

Manchester United (4-2-3-1): Lammens; Dalot, Maguire, Martinez, Shaw; Casemiro, Mainoo; Amad, Fernandes, Cunha; Mbeumo

Tottenham Hotspur: (3-4-2-1): Vicario; Palhinha, Romero, Van de Ven; Gray, Gallagher, Sarr, Udogie; Simons, Odobert; Solanke

Manchester United continued their fine league form last Sunday,¬†following up wins over Manchester City and Arsenal with a dramatic, narrow triumph at home against Fulham.

United looked set to see their winning run halted after going 2-0 up through Casemiro and Matheus Cunha, before Fulham scored twice late on. Yet in the 94th minute, Benjamin ≈†e≈°ko delivered a dramatic winner to seal all three points.

Spurs‚Äô last league victory came in December, but their spirited second-half display against Manchester City will give fans some encouragement.

After falling 2-0 behind in an extremely tepid first half performance, Spurs came out firing after the break, with Dominic Solanke scoring twice, including a spectacular scorpion kick to level the game. Spurs looked the more likely side to snatch a winner but ultimately had to settle for a 2-2 draw.

Manchester United manager Michael Carrick said: ‚ÄúSpurs certainly bring a challenge. The way they finished the game the other day, they‚Äôve had, over a period, players injured, a lot of changes to the team which makes things more difficult. They‚Äôre getting players back, they have really good attackers that look to stretch the backline and play forward and attack the box an awful lot.

‚ÄúA slightly different game to what we‚Äôve played in recent weeks but we‚Äôre looking forward to it. We are in a good place, the boys have worked well again this week. Feet on the ground, let‚Äôs not get carried away. It‚Äôs about what‚Äôs next. Big challenge ahead.‚Äù

Spurs boss Thomas Frank said: ‚ÄúI think Carrick has had a great start. It seems like he has injected a little bit of energy into the team. I think it looks like some of the players are in a good place.

‚ÄúWe know the threats that I also think they posed before from Bryan Mbeumo,¬†Amad, Cunha and Bruno Fernandes, he‚Äôs getting this team ticking. He has done that the last, I don‚Äôt know, four or five years. It has been incredible. It is a threat, it is a challenge, but we are looking forward to it.‚Äù

title: Dodgers Lose Andy Iba√±ez to AL Squad
description: The Athletics claimed infielder Andy Iba√±ez off waivers from the Los Angeles Dodgers on Friday, ending his short stay in L.A.
fullText:
The Athletics claimed infielder Andy Iba√±ez off waivers from the Los Angeles Dodgers on Friday.

The Dodgers signed Iba√±ez to a one-year, $1.2 million deal in January, but designated the infielder for assignment to bring back Michael Siani off waivers from the New York Yankees.

Iba√±ez came into the squad as relief for second baseman Tommy Edman, who is recovering from surgery on his ankle after struggling with injuries in 2025. He is progressing well through his injury, though, so the Dodgers may have put Iba√±ez on waivers believing Edman will be ready for Opening Day.

‚ÄúThe timetable is more just kind of as I progress. So, it‚Äôs kind of hard to to say exactly when I‚Äôll be ready to, you know, hop back in a Major League game again,‚Äù Edman said at DodgerFest Saturday. ‚ÄúAs of right now, this past week, I just took dry swings for the first time and then started my throwing progression again.

‚ÄúI got the boot off like two and a half weeks ago. The last two and a half weeks I‚Äôve been working into walking and pushing off it more. I got into like light skipping this week. Hopefully jogging next this next week. So you know, that‚Äôs kind of where I‚Äôm at right now and each step along the way, it‚Äôs kind of just being patient and making sure I‚Äôm hitting all the checkpoints with with no discomfort. And everything I‚Äôve done so far has felt really good.‚Äù

While Iba√±ez certainly met the Dodgers needs positionally, the odds he saw substantial game time as the season progressed were low.

In addition to Iba√±ez, the Dodgers had plenty of players available at second base, such as Miguel Rojas and Hyeseong Kim, who provide comparable numbers on both offense and defense.

With the Detroit Tigers in 2025, Iba√±ez played 91 games and hit four home runs while recording 21 RBIs. He slashed .239/.301/.352 for a .653 OPS last season, and profiled as a slightly above average defender.

With Iba√±ez now off the squad, the Dodgers have one fewer option at a logjammed second base.

Who do you want to see at second come Opening Day?

fullText: MarketsBy Bernard GoyderSaveExchange operator Cboe Global Markets Inc. plans to roll out options contracts that will enable binary bets on event outcomes, in a bid to enter the fast-growing prediction markets.In a departure from the approach taken by rivals, Cboe‚Äôs contracts will be regulated by the Securities and Exchange Commission, requiring a more onerous listing process that could help insulate the bourse from the avalanche of litigation facing the event contract market.

fullText: MarketsBy Katie GreifeldSaveRon Baron ‚Äî a longtime Elon Musk investor and a newcomer to the exchange-traded fund universe ‚Äî is already subverting norms in the $14 trillion industry. title: Dollar Set to Halt Three-Week Drop as Gold Rally Ends, Yen Falls
description: The dollar is headed toward its first weekly gain since early January as turmoil in broader financial markets drove investors into havens and traders unwound bets against the currency that paid off when it tumbled.
fullText: MarketsCurrenciesBy Miles J. Herszenhorn and George LeiSaveThe dollar is headed toward its first weekly gain since early January as turmoil in broader financial markets drove investors into havens and traders unwound bets against the currency that paid off when it tumbled. The Bloomberg Dollar Spot Index is up about 0.2% even after paring its gains Friday. The advance halted a three-week drop in the dollar that was fueled by speculation that the Trump administration‚Äôs policy shifts would spur foreign investors to dial back exposure to US assets.

title: BlackRock‚Äôs Rieder Dumps US Credit in Favor of Emerging Markets
description: BlackRock Inc.‚Äôs Rick Rieder said he‚Äôs reducing exposure to US investment-grade and high-yield bonds while increasing holdings of emerging-market debt, citing favorable valuations and a soft dollar.
fullText: MarketsBy Ye Xie, Matthew Miller, and Dani BurgerSaveBlackRock Inc.‚Äôs Rick Rieder said he‚Äôs reducing exposure to US investment-grade and high-yield bonds while increasing holdings of emerging-market debt, citing favorable valuations and a soft dollar.Yield spreads in US credit markets, which are hovering near the lowest in three decades, simply aren‚Äôt attractive enough at a time when bond supply is rising, BlackRock‚Äôs chief investment officer for global fixed income said in an interview on Bloomberg Television Friday.

title: S&P 500, Nasdaq 100 Jump More Than 1% as Tech-Stock Rout Eases
description: US stocks started to rebound on Friday as dip buyers capitalized on the artificial intelligence-fueled plunge in technology stocks.
fullText: MarketsBy Joel LeonSaveUS stocks started to rebound on Friday as dip buyers capitalized on the artificial intelligence-fueled plunge in technology stocks.The Nasdaq 100 Index advanced 1.7% at 12:27 p.m. in New York, with the benchmark looking to rally from its biggest three-session skid since April. The tech-heavy gauge is on track for its worst week since November. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 Index advanced 1.6%, while the Cboe Volatility Index hovered at around 20.

title: Driving Services Firm RAC Said to Add Banks to London IPO
description: Driving services provider RAC has appointed more advisers to help arrange its potential initial public offering in London, according to people familiar with the matter.
fullText: MarketsCity Of LondonBy Pablo Mayo Cerqueiro, Ruth David, and Swetha GopinathSaveDriving services provider RAC has appointed more advisers to help arrange its potential initial public offering in London, according to people familiar with the matter.The company, known for its breakdown cover, has picked Citigroup Inc., Banco Santander SA with Peel Hunt Ltd., BNP Paribas SA, Deutsche Bank AG and Morgan Stanley as joint bookrunners, said the people, who asked not to be identified to discuss private information. They are joining Bank of America Corp., Barclays Plc and Goldman Sachs Group Inc., which have been lined up to lead the share sale as global coordinators.

fullText: MarketsBy Avalon PernellSaveSpyGlass Pharma Inc. shares jumped 50% in the biopharmaceutical firm‚Äôs trading debut after it raised $150 million in an initial public offering.The company‚Äôs shares traded at $24 each as of 12:12 p.m. in New York, above its IPO price of $16 apiece. That gives the Aliso Viejo, California-based company a market value of about $766 million, based on the outstanding shares, according to a filing.

title: Jennifer Garner‚Äôs Once Upon a Farm Rises 17% After $198 Million IPO
description: Once Upon a Farm PBC, the organic kids snacks maker co-founded by actress Jennifer Garner, jumped 17% in its trading debut Friday, after the company and some of its investors raised $197.9 million in an initial public offering.
fullText: MarketsBy Janet Freund and Bailey LipschultzSaveOnce Upon a Farm PBC, the organic kids snacks maker co-founded by actress Jennifer Garner, jumped 17% in its trading debut Friday, after the company and some of its investors raised $197.9 million in an initial public offering.The shares opened at $21 each in New York, above its IPO price of $18. The trading gives the company a market value of $845 million, based on the outstanding shares.

title: EQT Life Sciences-Backed AgomAb Falls 8% After $200 Million IPO
description: AgomAb Therapeutics NV, a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company backed by EQT Life Sciences, opened 8.1% below its IPO price on Friday after the firm raised $200 million in a listing.
fullText: IndustriesBy Angel AdegbesanSaveAgomAb Therapeutics NV, a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company backed by EQT Life Sciences, opened 8.1% below its IPO price on Friday after the firm raised $200 million in a listing.Its American depositary receipts began trading at $14.70 each in New York, versus an initial public offering price of $16. The company sold 12.5 million ADRs on Thursday, after marketing them for $15 to $17 apiece. Each ADR represents one ordinary share, according to the regulatory filings.

title: Virtus Agrees to Buy Congo Cobalt Miner Amid US Pact
description: A firm headed by veterans of the US military and intelligence services has agreed to buy Chemaf SA, a troubled Congolese copper and cobalt producer that‚Äôs become a focal point in Washington‚Äôs efforts to shore up critical mineral supplies.
fullText: MarketsBy Michael J Kavanagh and William ClowesSaveA firm headed by veterans of the US military and intelligence services has agreed to buy Chemaf SA, a troubled Congolese copper and cobalt producer that‚Äôs become a focal point in Washington‚Äôs efforts to shore up critical mineral supplies.Virtus Minerals Inc. will pay an undisclosed sum for Chemaf and assume the firm‚Äôs liabilities, including debt owed to Trafigura Group, Managing Director Phil Braun told Bloomberg News on Thursday. The Delaware-registered company plans capital investments of $750 million, funded by debt and equity, he said on the sidelines of an event with Congolese President Felix Tshisekedi at the US Chamber of Commerce in Washington.

title: Compass Denied Bid to Temporarily Block Zillow Listing Rules
description: Compass Inc. lost a bid to temporarily block a Zillow Group Inc. ban on listings that have been advertised elsewhere first, after a judge ruled in favor of the home-search site in its legal battle with the largest US real estate brokerage.
fullText: MarketsBy Chris Dolmetsch and Paulina CacheroSaveCompass Inc. lost a bid to temporarily block a Zillow Group Inc. ban on listings that have been advertised elsewhere first, after a judge ruled in favor of the home-search site in its legal battle with the largest US real estate brokerage. US District Judge Jeannette Vargas on Friday denied a request by Compass for a preliminary halt to Zillow‚Äôs policy, court records show. That means the most widely used home-search site can continue to block certain listings while the antitrust lawsuit Compass filed in June proceeds.

title: Benghazi 2021 Attack Suspect Is in US Custody
description: A man suspected of being responsible for the deadly 2012 attack against an American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, is in US custody, FBI Director Kash Patel and Attorney General Pam Bondi said Friday.
fullText: MarketsBy Chris StrohmSaveA man suspected of being responsible for the deadly 2012 attack against an American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, is in US custody, FBI Director Kash Patel and Attorney General Pam Bondi said Friday.Zubayr Al-Bakoush is being charged with offenses that include murder, terrorism and arson, Bondi told reporters during a press conference in Washington.

title: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech‚Äôs $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
description: Nvidia Corp. shares soared Friday as investors snapped up shares of companies positioned to benefit from the vast sum of money that big technology firms have said they‚Äôll spend on artificial intelligence infrastructure this year.
fullText: MarketsBy Carmen ReinickeSaveNvidia Corp. shares soared Friday as investors snapped up shares of companies positioned to benefit from the vast sum of money that big technology firms have said they‚Äôll spend on artificial intelligence infrastructure this year.Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value. That snapped a five-day losing streak for Nvidia, which erased about $500 billion amid a broader selloff as software and technology shares tumbled.

title: Cantor Takeover to Cut O‚ÄôConnor Footprint Outside US
description: Cantor Fitzgerald LP is shedding much of O‚ÄôConnor‚Äôs presence outside of the US following its acquisition of the hedge fund from UBS Group AG, according to people familiar with the matter.
fullText: MarketsBy Irene Garcia PerezSaveCantor Fitzgerald LP is shedding much of O‚ÄôConnor‚Äôs presence outside of the US following its acquisition of the hedge fund from UBS Group AG, according to people familiar with the matter. While O‚ÄôConnor will continue to invest globally, the investment teams will be primarily based in the US with some individuals supporting them from other locations, the people said, asking not to be named discussing private information. As part of UBS, O‚ÄôConnor had teams based in the US, Europe and Asia.

title: Zen Hacker News
description: HHacker News is probably my favorite place on the internet. I‚Äôve been part of the community for over a decade, and I‚Äôve learned so much from the incredibly smart and thoughtful people there.
fullText:
HHacker News is probably my favorite place on the internet. I‚Äôve been part of the community for over a decade, and I‚Äôve learned so much from the incredibly smart and thoughtful people there.

I love the site. But it‚Äôs ugly.

There‚Äôs a certain charm to that brutal simplicity, and I know a lot of engineers love it‚Äîbut as a designer, it‚Äôs not for me. For a while now, I‚Äôve been thinking I should just build an extension that adds a few styles‚Äîa little more breathing room, better typography, and a dark mode would go a long way.

So over two weekends, I built Zen Hacker News‚Äîa Chrome extension that redesigns Hacker News with better typography, a customizable layout, and full keyboard navigation.

The two main features I‚Äôd like to call out are customization and keyboard navigation.

Customization comes in a bunch of different forms. The extension adds light and dark color modes, as well as a contrast mode. Typography is important to me, so I‚Äôve added options to change typefaces. There are now system defaults plus some personal favorites like IBM Plex Sans, Literata, and Recursive.

Theming was another big one. There are 22 color themes adapted from Radix. I know probably only the designers on the forum can tell the difference between Zen, Slate, Sand, Olive, and Sage‚Äîbut that‚Äôs ok. There are also fun ones like Cyan, Iris, and Tomato.

The feature I spent the most time on is keyboard navigation. There‚Äôs something I really love about keyboard-driven applications‚Äîif you use a tool a lot, it‚Äôs just easier to interact with it via keyboard.

The extension has high-level shortcuts for navigating pages‚ÄîG, B for Best, G, P for Profile, and so on. But the real value is being able to use the keyboard to navigate and take action on comments. Hit U on a focused comment to toggle upvoting. Hit Space to collapse or expand it. Hit Shift + Arrow Key to quickly jump between sibling comments.

I also built a chord indicator that shows which keys you‚Äôve entered as you type a shortcut sequence. It‚Äôs probably a little overkill, so there‚Äôs a setting to disable it‚Äîbut I think it makes the keyboard experience feel much more intentional.

There‚Äôs also a little easter egg‚Äîhit G, R and you‚Äôll jump to a random submission from Hacker News history. It‚Äôs a small thing, but I keep finding fascinating old threads I never would have stumbled on otherwise.

I‚Äôd been wanting to build this extension for a while, but what finally pushed me to do it was a desire to learn AI-assisted coding. Last week I wrote about Steve Yegge‚Äôs Gastown, and his vision of agents managing agents was provocative enough to make me give these tools another shot. I needed a project to learn on, and Zen HN was the perfect excuse.

But how exactly does one vibe code?

There was a lot of fumbling at first. I downloaded OpenCode after seeing recommendations on HN and tried to one-shot some apps‚Äîa link-in-bio site, a CRM scaffold. Nothing stuck. I didn‚Äôt yet have a feel for how to direct an agent or what to expect from one.

What got me over the plateau was watching someone work through real projects on YouTube. His videos on Warp and the OpenCode CLI helped me understand the rhythm of working with an agent rather than just prompting one.

I experimented with local models too‚ÄîQwen 3 Coder 30B is surprisingly capable, but painfully slow for coding tasks. It‚Äôs like comparing dialup to fiber. The vast majority of this project was built using Claude Code with Opus 4.5, which ended up being the best balance of price, speed, and quality. I burned through a week of Codex 5.2 tokens in a few sessions. It‚Äôs a better coding agent, but the cost adds up fast.

Once I found my rhythm, building with an agent was surprisingly easy. A few things stood out.

The more specific you are about what you want, the better the output. Vague prompts produce vague code. When I didn‚Äôt know how to be specific‚Äîwhen I wasn‚Äôt sure what to ask for‚ÄîI‚Äôd use plan mode to go back and forth with the agent until the direction was a little more clear. It would lay out several options, and I could work from there.

My debugging workflow didn‚Äôt change much either. If functionality wasn‚Äôt working, I‚Äôd ask it to add logging so we could troubleshoot what was going on. I‚Äôd send the logs back, explain the behavior I was seeing and ask how I could help troubleshoot. This worked quite well.

I will say‚Äîeven robots have a hard time with CSS. They were all terrible at it‚Äîwriting overly specific selectors, duplicating styles, ignoring what they‚Äôd already written. For a while I‚Äôd push back and make them reuse existing classes, but I gave up on that pretty quickly. I was trying to timebox this project, and honestly, the agent is the one who‚Äôll have to deal with the messy CSS in the future anyway. Well, at least partially.

We were able to get the UI mostly to where I wanted. If there was an issue in the interface, I‚Äôd inspect the DOM, find the relevant classes and drop it into the prompt. If there was a visual issue that was hard to describe, I‚Äôd take a screenshot. This mostly worked although it took many more iterations.

I am curious if this would have been easier starting with a framework instead of starting with existing styles that needed to be replaced. Or maybe I should have been more strict about the classes it was writing. Something to think about for my next project.

There‚Äôs more I want to do. I‚Äôm thinking about how to simplify the navigation. Right now it‚Äôs a bit cramped, and I‚Äôm torn between leaning harder into keyboard shortcuts or adding options to customize what appears. I‚Äôd also love a ‚Äúsurprise me‚Äù button for themes, since I keep bouncing between favorites and can never commit.

Zen Hacker News is open source, and you can install it from the Chrome Web Store.

I hope this is a useful contribution to the community that‚Äôs given me so much over the years.

title: Epstein files reveal deeper ties to scientists than previously known
description: Latest batch of documents show researchers consulting the financier and sex offender on publications, visas and more.
fullText:
Newly released files from the investigation of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein reveal that his ties to the scientific community were deeper than previously known.

Epstein, who died by suicide in 2019 after being arrested and charged with sex trafficking, was a wealthy financier who invested millions in science projects and socialized with researchers. It was already known that, after Epstein‚Äôs initial conviction for sex crimes in 2008, some scientists continued to associate with and take money from him, prompting fallout at top research institutions. For instance, Epstein gave US$800,000 to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Cambridge, which led two scientists to resign and the university to suspend another.

But last Friday‚Äôs release of more than three million files linked to Epstein ‚Äî including e-mails, photographs and financial documents ‚Äî has unveiled even more scientists in his orbit. Mentions of the researchers do not indicate wrongdoing or involvement in Epstein‚Äôs criminal activity, but they do shed light on how deeply he was involved in some of the science he funded. This is the largest batch of files made public by the US Department of Justice since Congress passed the Epstein Transparency Act late last year, mandating that the federal government release all documents pertaining to the financier.

The files include new information about interactions between Epstein and scientists whose links to him were already known. For example, the documents contain correspondence from theoretical physicist Lawrence Krauss, whose science-outreach organization received $250,000 from Epstein. ‚ÄúI thought we agreed no comment !!!!!,‚Äù Epstein wrote in 2018, as Krauss responded to media inquiries about an investigation of sexual misconduct that led to Krauss‚Äôs ousting from Arizona State University in Tempe.

Krauss explained his interaction with Epstein in an e-mail to Nature: ‚ÄúI sought out advice from essentially everyone I knew when false allegations about me were circulated.‚Äù He added that he had no knowledge of the ‚Äúhorrendous crimes‚Äù ‚Äî the sex trafficking ‚Äî that Epstein was later accused of. ‚ÄúI was as shocked as the rest of the world when he was arrested.‚Äù

The files also showed that Epstein maintained a list of nearly 30 top scientists, including Krauss, and revealed previously unknown connections with some of them. One was Lisa Randall, a theoretical physicist at Harvard University in Cambridge, who joked in an e-mail with Epstein about his house arrest (following his 2008 incarceration for soliciting sex with a minor, he was under house arrest in 2009‚Äì10). She also visited his private island in the Caribbean in 2014. Randall did not respond to Nature‚Äôs request for comment, but told the Harvard Crimson: ‚ÄúI am appalled by the full extent of allegations against him and deeply regret maintaining contact.‚Äù

Among the latest tranche of documents were also correspondences in which some scientists contacted Epstein with funding opportunities. For instance, in 2013, Nathan Wolfe, then a virologist at Stanford University in California, proposed that Epstein fund a sexual-behaviour study of undergraduate students to test ‚Äúour horny virus hypothesis‚Äù ‚Äî that certain vaginal and penile microorganisms might drive increased sexual activity.

In an e-mail to Nature, Wolfe says that although he visited Epstein‚Äôs homes in New York and Florida to discuss the research, Epstein never funded it. Wolfe says he regrets ‚Äúnot recognizing at the time how inappropriate [Epstein‚Äôs] framing was‚Äù and his association with the financier.

One of Epstein‚Äôs closest academic connections was mathematical biologist Martin Nowak. In his 2011 book SuperCooperators, Nowak describes how he was cold-called by Epstein while at Princeton University in New Jersey, and invited to Epstein‚Äôs island. ‚ÄúOn the last day of my visit, Jeffrey said he would build an institute for me,‚Äù Nowak wrote.

Nowak moved to Harvard in 2003 and, with a $6.5-million cheque from Epstein, founded the Program for Evolutionary Dynamics (PED), a centre that modelled evolution using mathematics. Epstein was not just a donor, but deeply involved: Office 610 in the PED building was known as ‚ÄòJeffrey‚Äôs Office‚Äô. Epstein visited several times each year, scheduling meetings with Nowak and other academics in the area. In 2021, after renewed scrutiny, Harvard closed the PED and placed sanctions on Nowak, which were lifted in 2023.

In 2008, Corina Tarnita, a mathematician from Romania, became Nowak‚Äôs PhD student. E-mails show she was in contact with Epstein as early as December 2008, six months after his conviction. They also show that, in April 2009, Tarnita provided wire-transfer details for two Romanian women, one of whom Epstein sent $10,000, and the other $5,000. The financial transaction, first reported by Romanian media outlet Semnal, prompted online speculation because of its apparent similarity to Epstein‚Äôs alleged wire payments for sex trafficking in Eastern Europe.

However, Tarnita, now a mathematical biologist at Princeton, says that the payments were scholarships for young female mathematicians in Romania. In a statement to Nature, she said that Epstein was ‚Äúinspired‚Äù by her own career trajectory ‚Äúto support other early-career women in mathematics‚Äù. A spokesperson for Princeton confirmed Tarnita‚Äôs account by showing Nature e-mails from 2008 between Tarnita and a Romanian academic, which corroborate that the wire transfers were for scholarships. There is no indication that Tarnita faced any criminal allegations related to Epstein.

doi: https://doi.org/10.1038/d41586-026-00388-0
